intro: Mentzelia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, bluish-green leaves with three distinct lobes. The plant produces showy, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Mentzelia triloba is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open habitats. It is an important species for pollinators and is considered a member of the Boraginaceae family.
